thread.section_title: Harry Kane takes inspiration from Barcelona as Tottenham look to catch Chelsea – Metro
thread.title: Harry Kane takes inspiration from Barcelona as Tottenham look to catch Chelsea
thread.title_full: Harry Kane takes inspiration from Barcelona as Tottenham look to catch Chelsea

author: louissealey1
title: Harry Kane takes inspiration from Barcelona as Tottenham look to catch Chelsea
text:
Tottenham and England striker Harry Kane (Picture: Getty) Harry Kane is taking inspiration from Barcelona’s remarkable Champions League comeback as Tottenham look to catch Chelsea in the title race.
Despite conceding a 4-1 deficit in the first-leg of their tie against Paris Saint-Germain, Barcelona secured their place in the quarter-finals thanks to a stunning 6-1 victory at the Camp Nou.
Arsene Wenger speaks out on Barcelona's interest in Hector Bellerin Spurs face a similarly uphill task, with Antonio Conte’s Blues moving 10 points clear in the race to lift the Premier League.
But Kane, who is expected to be ruled out for around five weeks with ankle ligament damage , has backed Tottenham to make up ground on their London rivals.
‘We have to keep believing and we have a team who do believe. As you saw from Barcelona against PSG, anything is possible in football,’ England striker Kane told EASPORTS.com .
‘We are in a good position, second in the table but quite a few points behind Chelsea.
Antonio Conte’s Chelsea are in control of the title race (Picture: Getty) Barcelona stunned Ligue 1 giants PSG at the Camp Nou (Picture: Getty) Kane is currently out injured after breaking down during the FA Cup win over Millwall (Picture: Getty) More: Football Arsene Wenger refuses to guarantee Alexis Sanchez will start against West Brom 
John Terry slams claims that he's unhappy with Antonio Conte at Chelsea 
Mbappe & the four Monaco stars Chelsea, Man Utd and Arsenal should be fighting to sign 
‘We have a run of games where we are playing teams around mid-table and in the bottom half, so if we can get some good results, you never know.’
Tottenham, who progressed to the semi-finals of the FA Cup with an emphatic win over League One Millwall last weekend, face Southampton on Sunday.
League leaders Chelsea, meanwhile, travel to Stoke City looking for their 22nd league victory of a fine season.
